_header: Lord Jesu Christ that sitteth above us
_description: Christ have mercy, translating ‘Jhesu Christe Domine qui supra nos sedes…Multi sunt pudiculi circa lubare vils’ — four monorhyming lines

Leicester4.Transcription:
Lord ihesu crist ȝat sitit abow housOf ȝos foul glotinus
                    deliuir ȝis housWan ȝow lochist on me as cat doth on ȝe
                    mousAbout ȝi bregirdil ligit manni aluus
Leicester4.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas. 
             “Anecdota Literaria: Scraps in English and Latin From A Manuscript of
                the Fourteenth Century, in the Library of the Corporation of Leicester.” 
             Retrospective Review
         1 (Aug., 1853): 419: 419.
